result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J. Hartl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall receive 96 days presentence credit should supervision be revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment within the next 6 weeks and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.  Defendant shall successfully attend an OWI Victim Impact Panel within 120 days of conviction.

records.addlTxt: Probation Intake Order

10:01 am. Case called along with 14CM27.  Defendant Nicholas J. Hartl in court in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer on 14CF236 and with Attorney Scott Van Klompenburg in 14CM27.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR and in Case No. 14CF236, heard his plea of No Contest to Count 1 of the Information-Knowingly Fleeing an Officer; the Court heard his plea of No Contest to Count 2 of the Information-Misd. Bail Jumping.  In Case No. 14CM27, the Court heard his plea of No Contest to Count 1 of the Criminal Complaint-Obstructing an Officer.  Ct. found his pleas were given FKVI, accepted his pleas, and found Def guilty in 13CF236 of Knowingly Fleeing an Officer and Misd. Bail Jumping and in 14CM27, guilty of Obstructing an Officer. Court found factual basis in the Crim. Compl./Info., heard from State, Defense and Defendant and sentenced as follows:
As to 12CF236:  S/W, probation of 21 months with terms-AODA with followup, Costs, Ab. Sob., No Bars, Must have valid DL to drive, and VIP w/in 120 days.  As an additional Order, as to Count 1, the Court revokes his DL for six months.   96 days of presentence credit as to Count 1. 
As to 14CM27:  S/W, probation for 21 months with terms as stated above, without the additional condition.
Defendant to report immediately to Columbia County Jail to serve the remainder of his time in that county.
Defendant to report back to Branch 1 on 12-12-2014 at 1:00 during Alcohol Court for a review of his compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas J. Hartl in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mayer heard on motion to modify bail, requests bail be modified to $500-1,000 cash bail, Court questions Atty Mayer, Atty Mayer responds, Atty Thompson heard, believes high bail is appropriate, requests it remains in effect. Court heard, cash bail is necessary, leaves bail as previously set.  Ct. addresses parties, if a meaningful and aggressive treatment is considered/available, Court may reconsider.

Court extends  prelim for cause due to def. requesting counsel.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Intern Greg Hodohl appears for State of Wisconsin under supervision of Robert Barrington.  Defendant does not appear.  Court resets to next week, notice to go to jail and SPD.  Review hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.

(1:06) Defendant Nicholas J. Hartl in court, in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan. (jail only) Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $20,000.00 cash  with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Shall not leave the State of Wisconsin;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:15 am.
